comments.commentBody:
So what?
Having the whole cabinet appointed by Putin is more important topic....

is Trump delusional?

is this the person who is mentally competent to be commander in chief?

The idea is the Obama administration did this, surely even Obama is not so stupid as to personally approve it.  That said he is responsible for what his administration did and the court is also responsible for its role.  Talk about trying to effect elections this is surely it.
A federal judge approves wire tapping requests from intelligence and law enforcement agencies not the president.

It is apparent Donald Trump is battling soundness and stability and losing.

To speak of the last truly elected President of the United States in this fashion is offensive to the majority of Americans, and should trigger serious consideration of the 25th Amendment to the US Constitution:

"In Case of the Removal of the President from Office, or of his Death, Resignation, or Inability to discharge the Powers and Duties of the said Office..."

I am no fan at all of the politics of VP Mike Pence, but I don't believe he or his surrogates conspired with the Kremlin to influence the presidential election, and I do believe he is responsible.

The United States and the world at large requires a sane, rational and responsible President in the post-nuclear age.

This joke stopped being funny some time ago.

Trump's refusal to release his tax returns and clear up financial ties to a foreign adversary, or distance himself from his opaque non-public business holdings, in light of the global intelligence gathered implicating the Kremlin in influencing the US Presidential election on his behalf is damning.

He is resorting to the language adopted by Jospeh Stalin by declaring the press "an enemy of the people."

He is separating children and grandchildren from parents and grandparents by force in what he called "a military operation."

Just 4 days after his campaign surrogate Sessions met with the Russians, WikiLeaks released 20,000 emails hacked from the DNC.

Trump must be resign.

We already knew Trump is a thin-skinned, paranoid bully.  What we don't know is what it will ultimately take for the GOP to cut their ties and let him sink on his own.  With a majority, Republicans don't need this guy to pass their agenda, but  every day they defend or deflect his ramblings they weaken their position.  Trump is embarrassing and exhausting.  Are they waiting for the mid-term polls?  They can't come soon enough.

About ten minutes after this, he was lying that Arnold Schwarzenegger didn't quit The Apprentice, he was "fired". Sad.

www.newyorkgritty.net

And in a related news story....

Reporter: "Mr. Spicer, what is the official White House position on whether Jeff Sessions had improper conversations with the Russian Ambassador?"

Sean Spicer: "Look over there! It's Haley's Comet!!!"

Don't you journalists understand Trump's MO yet? This isn't news, it's Trump making an outrageous statement so you will move the articles about investigating his role with Russia off page 1.

Wise up and quit pandering for ratings.

So true. Just a couple of days ago Trump read a speech off a teleprompter without having a twitter seizure, or insulting an audience member directly, and he was being hailed as the next John F Kennedy. What a joke. The media just can't seem to help themselves when shiny baubles are dangled in front of them.

A Lenten prayer:
God of mercy, as you scrambled the myriad tongues and languages in Babel to confound the wicked, we ask you to scramble America's nuclear codes, so that our president, who is bereft of sound mind and judgment, will be unable to access or understand them, and will find himself thwarted when he seeks to wreak destruction upon the face of the Earth. We ask this in the name of the Prince of Peace. Amen
He is incapable of introspection and has some kind of a god complex.

This is great news for Mr. Obama. He can now sue Trump for libel.

Or maybe it is bad news, where he and the Clintons could be shipped off to Guantanamo, like despots and tyrants do to their predecessors or "perceived" rivals. Or worse - just look at Kim Jong-un's behavior.

I hope there were legal wiretaps as part of the FBI's Russian Trump investigation angle in this election. Imagine all the juicy details of all the Trumpian shenanigans! Better than his taxes! All to make a Trump sweat. Americans should be tired of this guy winning and laughing all the way to the Alpha Bank, and finally hold him accountable for being a Trump.

When you're talking about secretive matters in a very visible and stationary location like Trump Tower on an unprotected android phone, it doesn't take a genius to figure out that someone is going to hack your calls. Heck, I'd bet an eight year old with a laptop and bit of time could do it. You don't need some vast conspiracy in order to blow Trump's spot up. I'm only surprised the Paparazzi didn't get there first. You'd think Trump of all people would know this by now.

What's even more hilarious to me is the 3 letter joke. Google it if you're not familiar. Trump has used letter number one and letter number two and we haven't even broken 100 days yet. Worse: If you know anything about excel, your circular reference warning should be going off right about now. Trump is relying on Breitbart to inform his inner circle when his inner circle is Breitbart's most likely source of inside information. Face-palm.

I just feel bad Barack Obama is getting dragged through the mud again. I wonder if he can sue for libel. Any lawyers out there?
Perhaps Mr. Trump should return to that insipid reality show.  It is possibly the only thing he hasn't bankrupted, and he can really show his "crazy" without anyone questioning his sanity.
"May" make?!

Since compassion and a keen mind
Are anti-Trump, the Pope's a find,
His broad span of knowledge
To Trump's mess of pottage,
Trump's vain, Francis the modest kind.

Comparing the two? An outrage,
One scatter brain, other a sage,
Trump's prime note of notice,
As petulant POTUS,
In lengthy lying does engage.

Trump has taken over our brains like a parasite and our neurons are screaming in agony but we cannot do anything about it. Or, more ominously, he might turn out to be a bullet to our collective brains. In my desperation, I am almost ready to consult seers and astrologers! Did Nostradamus say anything about him?

Many commenters here and elsewhere say, in essence, that Trump is insane and should be removed from office.  I agree he is insane -- but removing him from office would make Mike Pence our president.  Pence is much more dangerous.  Not only does Pence have an extreme right-wing agenda -- but he, unlike Trump, is smart and experienced.  If Trump is removed, Pence will do more long-term damage.  (My analysis leaves aside -- I must admit -- the possibility of paranoia-driven nuclear war.  Pence wouldn't do it.  Trump would.  Oh, well. . . )

In all his mutterings, rantings, and America First proclamations, the bankruptcy of DJT's idea that America withdraw from leadership on the world stage is revealed with the simple question: " Then what; who will take our place " ?

DJT's short-sighted demagoguery, posturing, grandstanding, and moth-to-a-flame reflex when he senses camera lights, are the exact antithesis to real leadership of America.

If you look carefully, President Trump is not "withdrawing" from the world stage. Indeed he is reasserting the US presence on the international scene with the caveat that it is expected that our allies finally step up and do their parts, or at least live up to the treaties that they have ratified.

It is as unfortunate as it is incorrect for you to make the assumption that President Trump is becoming an isolationist, particularly after Obama's legacy of appeasement, apology, and grovelling that set the United States on the track of become a second- or third-world power.

owl - We make no assumptions, only taking the man at his own word(s) regarding NATO being obsolete, the exact same wording Russia uses:

http://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-trump-germany-idUSKBN1500XW?il=0

thinking the spread of nukes is something desirable, undermining non-proliferation:

https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/monkey-cage/wp/2016/04/06/should-mor...

and aiming to take apart the framework underlying international trade, which is an edifice erected chiefly under U.S. auspices:

http://money.cnn.com/2017/03/02/news/economy/trump-trade-paper/

besides slashing U.N. funding.

DJT's placing self-proclaimed Leninists in policy positions (Google Bannon, leninist, dailybeast) buttresses the linked statements, which were made in clear English vocabulary terms, involving no assumptions.

I am angry and disgusted by how myopic and quite literally, dumb the Republican Party is today. There are 7 billion people on this planet. We do not need unwanted babies/children nor do we need severely handicapped fetuses either (abortion may be necessary). Then we turn to the GOP's desire to defund national health care (no alternate plan to the ACA has been offered - Republicans are eliminating millions from health insurance). Why can America not have what the rest of the industrialized nations offer their citizens? Besides granting no care to many women and many average earning American families we find Republicans want to defund protection of our air and water quality. Next we learn they have no intention of working with the nations of our Earth to limit C02 pollution. Allowing the sale of assault weapons (only used to kill humans) is normalized. This Republican Party has metasticized into a powerful organization against much of humanity and our world. Every senator and representative should be ashamed of their acceptance and support of stupidity. Caring for all raises the whole boat. Caring for all benefits all of us.

Well, in all fairness, it seems like Republicans are fully aware that the planet is overpopulated and are doing their part to control it.  Between climate change, undrinkable water, unbreathable air, lack of healthcare access, and a rise in assault weapons, we'll get the population under control in no time!

It didn't take long for prima donald to bring back the "it's Obama's fault" playbook, Ms Dowd. But if America really wants to understand the meaning of the word 'presidential,' she needs to set her gaze to the Obamas. Not just President Obama but also Mrs Obama. She has no obligation to be so magnanimous to President George W Bush but she does, just like President Clinton who has developed a genuine friendship with the Bushes, in spite of all the "bring dignity back to the presidency" talk by Mr W Bush. Now that is presidential!
I'm not sure it's presidential.  It only leads me to believe they're all on the same side and against the rest of us.

Presidential indeed by Mr. Obama and the former First Lady. We went from eloquent to arrogant, from class to, well, you know, and sane to who knows what afflicts Trump beyond his continual need for the ego boosting and self aggrandizement.
The media jumped the the "indoor Trump" like flies on rotten meat with their quick pronouncements of "presidential". No, our tin foil hat President is far from presidential. Sad.

But do you blame him for using his mad strategy? It works. The news cycle this morning talk about his tweets about President Obama instead of his connections to the Russian & Putin. So "Mad Trump" is just a sleight of hand. Nixon has nothing on Trump. The one responding to his tweets perfectly is Stephen King:

Stephen King Tweets Hilarious New Obama Conspiracies for Trump: ‘He’s in the Closet! He Has Scissors!’ http://www.sfgate.com/entertainment/the-wrap/article/Stephen-King-Tweets... via @SFGate

Welcome to the Fun House

It takes two to Tango, right?  That means only half the blame goes to Trump.  Both really need each other.  I agree, it feels sometimes like we're caught in the middle of some bad sociological experiment and we're the rat.

Obama didn't want to politicize the election so he did not appoint a special prosecutor as reported on the Maddow show. I wonder now, being he is getting blamed if he has any regrets? No drama Obama with no scandals and now scandals are appearing almost daily. Republican congress and voters who are continuing to provide the crutches need to really evaluate party over country. Can the blinders really shut all this out? Does the corruption at the top feed on the ignorance at the bottom?

We've been getting this "I am out of my league" style by Mr. Trump for too many times now. Well, this action today, in my opinion, has depleted his political capital in the eyes of enough, that it could mark the beginning of a long end.

This is an inept and a lonely man, that will get even lonelier by the day. This presidency is moving so fast to the bottom.
I don't believe Mr. Trump is interested in governing, however, I do believe that everything, and everyday, revolves around his business.

What a shame, we deserve better than that.

President Trump's defunct
Who used to fly a watersmooth blue jet
and What I want to know is
How do you like your blue-eyed boy now
Mr. Ryan?
Two months gone.Forty six to go.More than enough time to turn your country into a total madhouse.Putin,Kim Yong Un and co. are already laughing their heads of.
